</question from>



<question>



I bought jordan 11 and they glue coming out the front are they fake



its like some grey glue where the patten leather gets to the red sole they are black and red



</question>



<additional details>



its like some grey glue where the patten leather gets to the red sole they are black and red, i bought them on ebay



</additional details>



<answer from>



Jordan H
Member since: 26 July 2008
Total points: 414 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



did you buy them on the internet? or a swap meet? not always reliable



</answer>



<answer from>



nickloks
Member since: 13 December 2005
Total points: 214 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



it depends where you bought them from and how much you bought them for.  if you bought them on e bay for around 100 dollars than they're fake!!! however there are some e bay sellers that have authentic jordan shoes but the jordan 11's are usually priced around 400-500 dollars...depending on the condition,color, and size..don't be fooled by having an authentic shoe box and card that comes with the shoes because it is not hard to make those.



</answer>

<question from>



yours forever
Member since: 03 February 2008
Total points: 498 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



I want to become a fashion designer BUT..(advice needed!)?



I am 16 years old, and i'm very sure that i want to head into Fashion for a career. Problem is, on the island I live, there are no fashion institutes or any Magazine outlets [Vogue, Teen Vogue, Elle] that I could work for in the near future [as an intern, for example]. So since I am going to college and going to study art with other subjects as well, could anyone help me with what I can do after? Do I need to leave my country for sure to succeed in becoming what I want? The closest fashion school near my that I can think of is in Italy which is still a pretty far away place from where I live.



</question>



<answer from>



Haz M
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 100 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



get a load and sell your clothes on the internet first.. I'm pretty sure vogue would want someone who's clothes can actually sell from experience.. also maybe you should aim a little lower first? maybe topshop, new look, primark?



</answer>



<answer from>



Hannaaah...
Member since: 02 July 2008
Total points: 420 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



If you want to become a Fashion designer, then I suggest instead of going to college and studying art, you should go to a college that specialises in art and study Fashion design, fashion design and manufacturing etc. With the qualifications it wll be a lot easier to find and do an intern-ship, and some colleges even offer guaranteed placements at various places after studying there. You could go on to working for various designers, or even just designing for retail outlets, such as H&M and TopShop.

Keep in mind to do this you will need to get good grades in both Art and English especially, and make a portfolio. Most importantly you've got to be good at sewing and would start making clothes now.

You also said that you would like to work as an intern at Vogue, Elle etc. I'm going to tell you now, that this would not be the kind of intern you would want to do if you want to be a Fashion designer. They would not have opportunities for you to design clothes.



However, you may want to study fashion journalism, fashion photography or even styling at college, and these courses would be what hi fashion magazine would want to see when picking an intern. This is aming very high, but don't get your hopes up (:

Oh and I think you would have to move if you wanted to go to a good fashion institute.



</answer>

Are clothing sizes the same as uk in Japan?



UK Mens Shirt size = Japan size
large = 
Medium =
Small=

small=
Medium=
Large=

12 =
14 =
16=

<answer>

<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



I have the same issue with a wedding I have to go to in Oct.!  Fortunately, I have a very nice pants suit, it's a little too dressy for work, and with the right accessories will look just fine for a wedding.  Look for something similar in your local stores, make sure you ask yourself, if you would wear it to work, then it's probably not dressy enough if you would.  Don't forget to accessorize, that will lift anything you wear.



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>

Dress nice, dress comfortable - try to get in the middle of those.

or if you are a guy, wear a dark blue sports jacket at least... lol  (oh, and undies)



</answer>

<question from>



shyguy
Member since: 25 May 2006
Total points: 193 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Wearing female clothes?



I'm finding the allure of female clothes ( skirts, tights, underwear ) more and more inviting and don't really want anyone to find out. Should i just try a pair of tights or panties on or try to forget the whole thing.

It's lucky there are very few females out there who like guys in fem clothes as i have always found it difficult to say no to any females and would probably end up doing something i'd regret



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



You need help

x



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



You're finding out who you are and what you like. I have no problem at all with that. Guys try shaving in unorthodox ways or in unorthodox places and they learn in an itchy way why the hair is there in the first place. These are just things that people do. When I'm on my 12-speed bicycle, I will sometimes pedal a little further than I have before just to see how my body will react the next day. I am experimenting and pushing myself a little to not just make myself stronger, but to determine my limits. Back before 1987, I drank too much. It nearly killed me. I quit. It has been 21 years now of no alcohol. I discovered it was no good for me at all. I stopped using it. You find all kinds of things out about yourself. It is good to experiment. Use your head and explore to your heart's content. I personally have never been moved in the direction which interests you, but I can tell you here in writing if you wanted to slip into something soft and comfortable and feminine it wouldn't bother me a bit because in my opinion, that is your business. That is between you and you. You may find you like some things and not like others. Like heels will be out while soft clothing will be in, like undergarments... everyone is different. I like clothing which is loose-fitting. That is because I move a lot and make quick movements and don't want to have my clothing confining me. How else can you really find out what you like until you give it a go?

It is all so low-key. No big deal. No fanfare of trumpets. Just grab the angora or the panties or silk or whatever. You will find out fairly quickly what you like and what doesn't work for you.



Then come hair styles. You will experiment there, too. You know, finding footwear that is right for you is yet another area of your life where it pays to get it right, so you have to try a lot of things which do not fit your feet right before you find the right footwear.

Then come friends. You try this person and that person, and finally you meet someone and the two of you "click."



Source(s):



I hope I have helped to relax you about the whole thing. It is so low-key... no major event, here... just have fun with it is what I would tell you if you were standing in front of the bed with a whole lavish wardrobe laid out before you, just waiting for you to start trying things on.

Sent to you with positive energies frm Chris in South Portland, Maine, U.S.A. I am 65, and all my life I reinvent myself every day. You have to be that aware of yourself to be of much use to others, as well. Stay current with yourself. Find what you like, leave what you do not care for far, far behind you. This is a recipe for a good life.



- C.



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>

</answer>

<question from>



♥ Just. Me ♥
Member since: 01 August 2008

</question from>



<question>



What should I wear to this bar mitzvah?



I go to this really small all-girls school that has, like, 2 Jewish girls out of a class of 60, so it is really important to make a good impression on all the bar mitzvahs.

I have gone to 4 Bat Mitzvahs and 4 Bar Mitzvahs, so this will be my 5th (:

What should I wear? I'm thinking black mini dress. I'm not sure where to buy it from though! The budget is probably around $400 or $500 max. on the dress. Heels are covered, my mom will lend me a pair of her Diors.

Links, store names, anything please?



</question>



<additional details>



To the party (: skirt and shirt to the temple!



Serious answers only.

The fact that it is a guys party makes it all the more important!



I meant 5th bar mitzvah not like bar and bat mitzvah.

<answer>



I am a black-shoe lover myself, but contrary to what most people say, you can in fact wear black and brown together because they are both neutrals. Keep in mind, khaki is another version of brown.  I personally think brown pants, a black shirt and belt, and black shoes look fine.  Not my favorite outfit, but it looks ok.  Now, on to your friend.
It is ok to wear brown shoes with black pants as long as you don't wear black socks, you do wear a black belt, and the shirt (or coat or both) have brown in them.



Source(s):



Self-proclaimed Fashionista



</answer>

<answer>



I'm in the US, but theres jeans all over the place for short people.  In fact they are easier to find.  Even in clearance and sales, theres always the short jeans left.  Even though I'm only 5'5, I have long legs, and can only buy jeans that comes in different lengths (inseams) so that I can get the longest ones.

You go buy jeans with no certain length that is supposedly ok for any height, they are always too damn short.

If you ask me someone short has it easy to find jeans.  They make every size from tiny 0 to huge 18 in short lengths, so I really dont know whats the problem.

IF you are very very tiny and thin, little girls jeans could fit.

<answer>

I do wish the clothing industry would take notice that there are many petite women. Both of my grandmothers were shorter than me!

<answer>



Do you mean the black, knee length, wool efforts with the turn-back collar and the split at the back; if so they are called Crombie coats or just Crombies. Genuine Crombie coats are very pricey though, and most of the ones worn by bouncers are cheap copies, but still called Crombies.

<question>



My Country Tweed Hat got half inched, where can I get a good replacement?



In respect of a surly set of travellers and their mono-browed-cyclop sprogglets as they clambered into a trough full of fodder and wares gathered by myself and fellow charitable workers from the village, namely buns, biscuits, butcher scraps and the like, I sang a wondrous Hymn in lew of the Harvest, "Harvest Dreams". Standing upright as my booming baritone was accompanied by happy slurpings and belchings, I saw from the corner of my eye a most peculiar thing. 
A huge Monster! Trampling through the fields gobbling up the livestock and going "Rrraaaaaaaaagggh!" Breathing fire it sent a farm up in flames! The inhabitants were running around going "Help! Help! My heads on fire!" 
Next thing, I was flummoxed to find myself faced with leering travellers. Having just ate their fill, they smirked, preened and fawned about the place laughing as I was subject to them taking it turns to wear my tweed hat pulling faces and smirking behind their grubby hands. One even did this affronty blowing a continual and spluttery raspberry and flapping his arms about like a squid with Elton John tip toeing behind it . .. but I understand through his Father's gestures he was a bit "Special".
Well. . . this smacks of the Supernatural thought I, as I drove away. Looking at the rear view mirror, they were all jumping about jabbering and still lauding my hat such as it was. Remarkable. Ah well, if it makes them happy who am I to deny them such pleasures eh?



</question>



<answer from>



Viper
Member since: 20 July 2008
Total points: 1267 (Level 3)



</answer from>

</answer>

<question>

I have a black suit (black pants, black jacket)...would that look weird wearing it to an event? It's not formal but women are wearing cocktail dresses and some guys have blazers. I don't have a sports coat though...Also, it's at a hotel with a rooftop bar / lounge area. What kind of shirt should I wear underneath? Or would a suit be too much? Should I just wear a nice shirt?



</question>



<answer from>



Maxwell
Member since: 04 March 2008
Total points: 595 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yea. My guess is if there wearing Blazers to something not formal, then they are also wearing jeans. Hmm try something Longsleeved thats casual with jeans or slacks. w/e. I think a suit is a bit much for a Rooftop bar/ lounge event. Im starting to like cardigans. You could always rock a nice cardigan with a nice shirt under it.



</answer>

<original file>index;_ylt=AoJ1lgqeyV3JYxiwclN16LZ0CAx0767.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk45653.txt</current file name>



<category>



Beauty & Style



Fashion & Accessories



</category>



<question from>



jennifer...
Member since: 06 August 2008
Total points: 278 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Going on a student exchange to new york for 4 months over winter.....what to pack? and what to wear?



Hi there iam going on a student exchage trip to new york, from november through to febuary, i have heard that the weather can be really cold, i will be doing a lot of walking in the cold weather, which iam not looking forward to, i know it sounds silly but iam not a big fan of wearing huge coats and jackets so thinner items of clothes would be better, i dont have a clue what to pack and what to wear?, so a lot of help is needed, also you hints and tips for keeping warm would be helpful aswell. thanks

p.s i also have msn or yahoo messenger and aim, if you wish to help me through that



</question>



<answer from>



Jill P
Member since: 03 September 2008
Total points: 562 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is freezing there!! I live in Philadelphia so it's pretty close but its worse there. Bring jackets, sweaters, boots (uggs), gloves scarves. your going to freeze with thinner items.

http://yourcheapestfashionstatement.blog...



Source(s):



http://yourcheapestfashionstatement.blog...



</answer>



<answer from>



RosieRed
Member since: 06 June 2008
Total points: 1485 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Winter in NY is cold -- definitely need a warm coat, hat, gloves etc - there will probably be a few snow storms.



Mostly casual clothes - jeans, sweaters, T-shirts etc -- Students dress very casually. New Yorkers wear a lot of black, so you'll fit right in w/ that :-)  -- but on the other hand, you can dress as unique as you please, because nothing can be too crazy in NY city! There are some very unique characters there!



A few nice outfits - if you go to any nice restaurants, etc

Not sure where you're coming from, but try not to flip out about the skyscrapers -- that's a dead giveaway you're from out of town :-)



Have fun!! New York City is the city that never sleeps, so there's ALWAYS  something to do!



</answer>

What should I wear to a job interview for the store 'Topshop' and what to wear once working there?

</question>



<answer from>



moonz91
Member since: 01 February 2008
Total points: 349 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



The trick is to wear what is in fashion all right now...unlike other stores Top shop is like a fashion catwalk



You got to know like you know whats hot and whats not. so do your homework: browse shop windows, and look for the trends that suit you. the key is smart/causal and accessorizes (and something bright so you stand out/ but not to bright/ just like a top or an accessorize) for the interview.

when you get the job what to wear because your will be in the environment seeing the trends and then you can mix and match to your own taste



here is a little home work i did earlier....good luck



http://www.fashiontrendsetter.com/conten...

www.vogue.co.uk/fashion/trends/
www.style.com/trends/

<original file>index;_ylt=AssYkzFCykBXanwVs3YEyARzCAx26d9.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk47804.txt</current file name>



<category>



Beauty & Style



Fashion & Accessories



</category>



<question from>



DotDotMe
Member since: 02 August 2008
Total points: 169 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Is this chanel bag fake?



hi



i want to buy this chanel bag but i don't know if it is fake or not the only picture i have is this one so if any can help that will be nice.
http://www.top-saler.com/uploadfiles/200...

thank you for your answers



</question>



<additional details>



how can you tell if its fake



because if it is not a big noticable detail from an orginal (if it fake)then it is ok to get



no it is not becca what about this bag
http://www.top-saler.com/uploadfiles/200...



listen myth go **** yourself i didnt ask for your damn opinion if i wanted it i would have asked but i didnt



</additional details>



<answer from>



Linda S
Member since: 03 April 2007
Total points: 15035 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Fashion & Accessories



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Both are obvious fakes. For the first: I can tell it's fake because of several things including the wonky logo, the C's are linked the wrong way.  The stitching is sloppy.  They don't use that type of hardware on the straps of the authentic bags.  I can't find that style on the Chanel website, or any style similar. It was discontinued due to a flood of cheap fakes.



The second bag is even more obviously fake because of the shiny cheap plastic material and the tacky embossed Chanel logo.  Again, it's not on the Chanel website and I don't think they even made a bag like that.  Plus the site it's on- "Top Saler" states in the fine print it sell replicas, or as they are know by people in the Fashion business "counterfeits".  It's a standard china-based webstore that sells counterfeit brand and designer names.  I've seen many of these sites before."Top-saler" is notorious for spamming anywhere and everywhere on the internet.  The purseforum message board lists website that sell authentic and the ones that are know to sell fake, and "top Saler" is listed in the fakes. Everything on the site is fake and they have instruction on how to circumvent border seizures, which means they know they are selling counterfeits.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanx alot of info



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Buzzard

rachelle...

<answer>



Hi...  Here's the answer you want and it's factual - trust me... And it just doesn't apply to white JEANS !!!  (OMG!!!!)  It applies to all feminine articles of outer wear..
The color WHITE is a summer color...  Labor Day signifies basically the last day of Summer, so in other words, put away your white high heels, your white skirts, and white SLACKS, and bring out the darker shades...!!! Factual.....
And I myself, being a transvestite, even know this fact...
Enjoy...
Regards,
Rachelle In High Heels



</answer>

<question>



How can i find my true clothes style?



I wear lots of different styles of clothing - i would like to find what is my KEY style.....

how do i find that out?



</question>



<answer from>



yo-yo
Member since: 19 April 2007
Total points: 1889 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



hmmm That's a tough one! I think you like color, you know. You wear almost everything so I guess that's your style.



Think about it, do you like jeans more then skirts, must you wear sun glasses even when there is no sun, ask your self all these questions. If you like almost anything, then maybe your fashion foward type a person.

Me.... I wear nothing but black, never do I wear color. I hate wearing color, I feel like Ima look fat. Sounds weair but its true!



~yoyo



</answer>



<asker's comment>

</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Dalia R
Member since: 30 August 2008
Total points: 314 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



take a quiz on what your style is



</answer>



<answer from>



lacytigh...
Member since: 13 September 2008
Total points: 219 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I've just recently started discovering my style. Before I would wear and buy just everything, but now i've started college and i have to choose an outfit every morning. I'm finding that like the outfits I feel best in- do collectively create a definite style (different to anyone elses but still a style). So my advice would be to decide what you feel best expresses the type of person you are, or you want to be seen as, or what makes you feel really good and true to yourself. DUmp the rest of your wardrobe or edit it or whatever and you will have a personal style! hope i helped........



</answer>



<answer from>



Shelby.
Member since: 25 August 2008
Total points: 201 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



go through your wardrobe and pick out a couple of key feautres you absolutely love and like the way they fit.
see if they looks a certain style. 
or you might not have a 'label' style (which is a good thing =)
originality is always better



</answer>

<question>



Why are fashion models so freakishly thin?



Every you look in the media they show these emaciated looking women who look like they should be in an Ethiopian refugee camp. With their ribs and  bones popping out every where. What is the allure of them? I remember when models actually had gorgeous shapes like Cindy Crawford and Claudia Schiffer, Why has they media made women have such a distorted view of beauty and are women actually buying into it?



</question>



<additional details>



To Queen E: Great answer. I agree. These poor women are on the brink of starvation and they look revolting in those beautiful clothes. I'm a fashion major and I have always been disgusted by the industries gross lack of negligence to actually take the proper measures to ensure that these models are healthy. I think clothes look better on shapely healthy sized people not twigs.



To Laura_S: Good to hear your getting help for your issue. I must agree that it's good to be healthy slender not starved slender. Alot of these women are so thin that they don't realize the jeopardy their health is in. I think it's insane that women should be held to these impossible standards of thiness. Not to discriminate against natuarally thin models but there are those that are setting a bad example for young girls and women. Which needs to stop. It's sick and kills innocent people due to the fact that this is what people set their physical worth on.



</additional details>

Total points: 95 (Level 1)

<answer>

To me, it is still the most disturbing thing I see almost everyday, I love fashion and I watch runway shows religiously,but honestly- everytime I see a stick thin model, I don't look at the clothing, I look at a suffering person who will die soon.

<question from>

<question>



What size thigh is best for skinny jeans?



I am that kind of guy who is into that whole skater look. So what size thighs are good for skinny jeans? My waste size is a 32 and my thighs arent all that big. So if you could help me out, that'd  be great! -thanks



</question>



<answer from>



All!c@
Member since: 01 January 2007
Total points: 1788 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



That actually made me shake my head a little bit when I read it...



You don't need to be a certain size to wear them. They aren't called "skinny" jeans because you need to be skinny to wear them. I wear skinny jeans all the time, and I'm not exactly a size 2.



If you like the look, and you feel like you could rock it, then gd it go ahead and buy some! It's not the style, it's the confidence that you need to pull off the style. YOU have to



MAKE
IT
WORK



^^ So go out and buy skinny jeans. And pull those betches off.



: )



Source(s):



ME



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Ha thanks! That wasnt exactly the answer i was looking for, but it opened my eyes to a different view on this. Thanks again!



</asker's comment>

<question>



Is it ok to sell hair accessories at a garage sale?

</question>



<answer from>



id2ga
Member since: 30 May 2007
Total points: 6370 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Most people won't buy certain things used--and hair accessories is one of those things. You can try washing them and sterilizing them--but don't be surprised if they don't sell.



</answer>



<answer from>



Sarah Parker
Member since: 11 September 2008
Total points: 163 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I guess if they're clean and the latest fashion it's probably okay.

<question>

retail/marketing management

<answer from>



girl
Member since: 26 September 2006

</answer from>



<answer>



I would start advertising with fashion blogs to get word out, or somewhere like that because I own a fashion blog - a lot of people come to you about this stuff

<answer from>



nutritio...
Member since: 25 August 2008
Total points: 1384 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>

There are so many things you can do to reach out to potential an existing customers to advertise a new product. Try to be creative. Your business can't survive if you can't brainstorm at least a few ideas.



</answer>

<question>



If you have uggs like the boots or any kind of boots?



my friends were tellin my that i haaaev to get this waterproof thing for the boots?



wht is it called



and where can you get it from?
and what does it do?



</question>



<additional details>



do u put it on before or after? you go outside?



</additional details>



<answer from>



dead can dance
Member since: 07 July 2008
Total points: 1260 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Uggs are nasty and ugly.  There is a spray that you can put on the boots to help protect them from water.



Source(s):



ahhhhh before...if you put it on after that kind of defeats the whole purpose.



</answer>



<answer from>



Kitty
Member since: 22 March 2008
Total points: 2421 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Go into any shoe shop and they're normally on the counter.
It'll be called something different in every shop. It stops you're shoes getting absolutely ruined in light rain. It will not protect your shoes in a heavy shower, nothing will.



</answer>



<answer from>



Lids484
Member since: 06 August 2008
Total points: 157 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Before, it's like putting on a seal so the boots don't get all gross and watery. There is also conditioner and stuff that you can put on after for things like salt stains. You can get it at both any shoe store or were you bought your uggs, or online at http://www.uggaustralia.com/ProductDetai...



</answer>



<answer from>



Femme fatale
Member since: 23 March 2008
Total points: 1490 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is called waterproofing spray, you can get it from shoe shop. It helps shoes or bags..etc from moisture, resistant to oil and dirt.



Spray it before and leave for 30minutes to dry.



</answer>
